page.title: 12A monument in Stoke
page.content: If you walk along the boulevard alongside London Road in West End you will come to a stone monument.The monument is to a bus conductor called Timothy Trow. In 1894 a canal ran alongside London Road,Stoke.Trams passed along this road.It was on April 13th that a young tram conductor was passing along London Road in a tram when he saw a small girl fall into the canal.He got off the tram and jumped into the canal to rescue her.Unfortunately,Trow had an attack of cramp and was drowned.The girl was rescued by an onlooker.Trow's body was pulled out half an hour later.Local people gave donations to provide a monument to his memory. The canal was later filled in,but the monument can still be seen along the boulevard,a memorial to a brave man.
